content.question:
Figure 1 illustrates a process that occurs in a certain group of organisms.

Figure 1. Model of spliceosome activity

Which of the following best predicts the importance of this process?

choices.label: This process is common to all members of Eukarya and allows noncoding regions of <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be removed so that proteins with the correct amino acid sequence are produced.
This process is common to all members of Archaea and allows these organisms to survive harsh environments.
This process is common to all organisms and is a conserved <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repair mechanism.
This process is common to vertebrates and allows the production of large and complicated proteins.

content.answer: This process is common to all members of Eukarya and allows noncoding regions of <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be removed so that proteins with the correct amino acid sequence are produced.
